column4: ok, so i'm having trouble booting after upgrading to 12.04, it seems some grub stuff got messed up. previous versions of ubuntu were booting with the root=UUID=foo instead of root=/dev/sda1. apparently my drive is not coming up as /dev/sda1. but if i replace /dev/sda1 with UUID=foo, it still won't boot
i cant remember if the initrd has blkid, but it probably should. if not you can check that the uuid'ed device appears in /dev/disk/by-uuid
i'm not sure how to get a shell on initrd i only get as far as grub, or i can get farther with older versions of ubuntu. the uuid i tried to add to my new grub config is definitely there
you could modify the iso to include your url
